page.title: 08A Big Farm
page.content: One farm we went to had 450 acres. They grow wheat, potatoes, kale, fodderbeet and barley. They have 200 acres of grass for grazing cattle, silage making and hay. To plant 25 acres of potatoes it takes about 10 days. The milk quota affected them them when they joined the EEC because the farmers had to cut down on milk. This particular farm sold 10 cows for slaughter. They now have 88 cows. The big farms have facilities for making silage because they have more modern equipment which is very expensive.
